meanings.definition: Deprive (someone) of power, rights, or possessions.
meanings.sent1: The king decided to divest the nobleman of his title and lands.
meanings.sent2: She had to divest her brother of his control over the family business.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick was to divest the volunteer of their ability to speak.
meanings.sent4: The storm seemed to divest the trees of their leaves in one powerful gust.
meanings.sent5: The evil sorcerer's curse would divest the hero of his strength and courage.

meanings.definition: Rid oneself of something that one no longer wants or requires.
meanings.sent1: After the breakup, she decided to divest herself of all the gifts he had given her.
meanings.sent2: He needed to divest his wardrobe of old clothes to make space for new ones.
meanings.sent3: The cluttered attic was a challenge to divest of forgotten treasures.
meanings.sent4: She wanted to divest her mind of negative thoughts and focus on positivity.
meanings.sent5: The decision to divest the company of unprofitable branches was a difficult one.
